metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5389 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
WebExtensions could use the "mozAddonManager" API by modifying the CSP headers on sites with the appropriate permissions and then using host requests to redirect script loads to a malicious site. This allows a malicious extension to then install additional extensions without explicit user permission. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 51.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5389` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 51.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 51.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 51.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 51.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '51.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
